column4: Hello. Question from a newbie.  When I install software using the package manager...I never can find the software I installed...where exactly does it go after installation?
many packages doesn't add a menu entry. just run them from Alt+f2 for example or a terminal
Will running it from a terminal give me a graphical program?
if you want to rip audio cd ubuntu comes with soundjuicer
I just want to convert a .wav file into a .mp3
use soundconverter then it has anice gui. you can install and use lame if you prefer (command line)
It tells me I need the GStreamer lame plugin...
once you are at it install all the other gstreamer plugins
probably you need to enable the multiverse repo
How is that done..I am very new to this.
go to System>Admin>Software Sources and check all the repos from the first tab
also read the link ubotu told you
I get an error. Dependacy is not satisfiable.
o_O when installing what? gstreamer lame?
Okay I got it working. Thank you for your help.
